definition: to insist on/to demand/to impose
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
variant of 強|强[jiang4]
variant of 強|强[qiang3]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
variant of 強|强[qiang2]
surname Qiang
stubborn/unyielding
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech

sentences.english: It is the same with our children.
sentences.chinese: 人各有志，不必强求，对儿女也是如此。

sentences.english: If feelings are hard I'd rather be alone all my life.
sentences.chinese: 如果激情是强求我宁愿一生顾影自怜。

sentences.english: Don't try to make our house the neatest in the neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 不要强求把我们的房子弄成全社区最干净的。

sentences.english: And you can't force happiness to happen—but you can make sure you are aware of it when it does.
sentences.chinese: 快乐无法强求，但一旦降临，你要确信自己有所体察。

sentences.english: The love of 100% is importuned to not was necessary between husband and wife, also unlikely.
sentences.chinese: 夫妻之间强求100%的爱没有必要，也不大可能。

sentences.english: In their game of reopened possibilities, he didn’t want to overplay his own hand.
sentences.chinese: 在他们有可能重新开始的恋爱游戏中，雷斯不想强求。

sentences.english: Everything has it 's destiny, we cannot importune.
sentences.chinese: 万物都有它的宿命，我们不能强求。

sentences.english: Therefore, the right attitude to fame and wealth is not to importune and not to shuffle them.
sentences.chinese: 所以，对名利的态度应该是，不强求，也不推诿。

sentences.english: Love is about wanting to be together but be okay when you are apart.
sentences.chinese: 爱情是渴望双方在一起，但并不强求，而是好聚好散。

sentences.english: Force, will only make you more tired.
sentences.chinese: 强求了，只会让自己更累。

sentences.english: Close to is it casual, so nothing good to eat fruit.
sentences.chinese: 合则来不合则散，强求没啥好果子吃。

sentences.english: Not too concerned about everything, but without the need to force it all Going.
sentences.chinese: 凡事不必太在意，更不需去强求，一切随缘。

sentences.english: You shouldn't impose your philosophy of life on others, everyone has their own way of living.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都有自己的处世哲学，你不能强求别人怎样。

sentences.english: We are firmly opposed to the policy of a Procrustean bed.
sentences.chinese: 我们坚决反对强求一致的政策。

sentences.english: The foundation was being importuned by fundraisers to contribute to new charities.
sentences.chinese: 募捐者正强求基金会为慈善事业捐款。

definition: to let nature take its course (idiom)

lit. if you have to use force to break a melon off the vine, it won't taste sweet (because it's only when the melon is ripe that it can be removed with just a slight twist) (idiom)/fig. if sth is not meant to be, it's no use trying to force it to happen
pinyin: qiang3 niu3 de5 gua1 bu4 tian2

definition: demanding
to mind/to brood over/to be concerned about
to bother about/to haggle/to bicker/to argue/plan/stratagem
at home wherever one is (idiom); ready to adapt/flexible/to accept circumstances with good will
to bring trouble on oneself (idiom)
to make extravagant demands/an unreasonable request
to force someone to do something
the matter depends on the individual (idiom); it is a matter for your own effort/With effort, one can achieve anything.
everything
to try one's utmost/to strive
inappropriate or presumptuous demands
lit. when the boat gets to the pier-head, it will go straight with the current (proverb)/fig. everything will be all right/cf 車到山前必有路，船到橋頭自然直|车到山前必有路，船到桥头自然直
pinyin: chuan2 dao4 qiao2 tou2 zi4 ran2 zhi2

definition: to come to accept an unpleasant fact/to get over sth/to cheer up
take your time/take it easy
